text: Miguel Ángel Tabet Balady (December 24, 1941 – April 7, 2020) was a Venezuelan theologian, Catholic priest, author, and exegete. He was born in Caracas, Venezuela. Tábet lived and worked in Rome, Italy. He was a professor of biblical hermeneutics, the study of the principles of the Bible, at the Pontifical University of the Holy Cross in Rome. Tabet died from COVID-19 during the 2019–20 coronavirus pandemic in Rome, Italy, on April 7, 2020, at the age of 78. ==References== Category:1941 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Rome Category:Venezuelan Roman Catholic priests Category:Christian theologians Category:Venezuelan academics
title: Miguel Ángel Tábet
